verses.roman:
te 'nvasajjanta rājanyā
niṣeddhuṁ pathi kecana
saṁyattā uddhṛteṣv-āsā
grāma-siṁhā yathā harim

synonyms: te—they; anvasajjanta—followed from behind; rājanyāḥ—the kings; niṣeddhum—to check Him; pathi—on the path; kecana—some of them; saṁyattāḥ—ready; uddhṛta—raised; iṣu-āsāḥ—whose bows; grāma-siṁhā—"lions of the village" (dogs); yathā—as; harim—a lion.
translation: The kings pursued the Lord like village dogs chasing a lion. Some kings, raising their bows, stationed themselves on the road to stop Him as He passed by.
